default: (a) a {@item light crossbow|PHB} and {@item crossbow bolts (20)|PHB|20 bolts} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=AcidArmyBookCrossovers|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|PHB} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|PHB}

classFeature.name: Cardcasting
entries: An event in your past, or in the life of a parent or ancestor, imprinted you with the Blue King's Blessing, enabling you to cast cards from a deck of Crossovers. This blessing, whatever its cause, permits you access to the art of deckmancy. See {@book chapter 1|AcidArmyBookCrossovers|1} for the general rules of cardcasting and {@book chapter 2|AcidArmyBookCrossovers|2} for the {@filter deckmancer card list|spells|class=deckmancer}.

entries.name: Deckmancy
entries: Deckmancy is an intricate art, governed strictly by the rules laid out long ago by the Blue King and the Red King.
Combat starts with 2 elixir ready, and you generate 2 more elixir per turn. You may never hold or spend more than 5 elixir at once.

entries.name: Elixir Cost
entries: The Deckmancer table shows how many {@filter cards|spells|class=deckmancer} of each elixir cost you have in your deck. To cast one of these cards, you must spend its elixir cost or one extra elixir to mirror the card. See {@book chapter 1|AcidArmyBookCrossovers|1} for the entry on mirroring a card. You will have a steady supply of elixir during combat, and elixir is produced and simultaneously spent outside of combat through ritual casting. You may not mirror a ritual cast.

entries.name: Cards Owned of 1-Elixir and Higher
entries: You own one 1-elixir card and one 2-elixir card of your choice from the {@filter deckmancer card list|spells|class=deckmancer}.

You gain an additional card of your choice at each level, according to the elixir costs given in the deckmancer table. For instance, when you reach 3rd level in this class, you can gain one new 1-elixir card.

entries.name: Cardcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your cardcasting ability for your cards, since the placement and timing of your cards relies on your ability to recognize situations and respond accordingly. You use your Wisdom whenever a card refers to your cardcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a card you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Cardcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item playing card set|phb} as a cardcasting focus for your deckmancer cards.

classFeature.name: Deck Archetype
entries: Choose a deck archetype, which describes your deckmancer playstyle, from the list of available archetypes.
Your choice grants you features when you choose it at 1st level and again at 6th, 14th, and 18th level.

classFeature.name: Dark Elixir Attunement
entries: At 2nd level, you tap into a deep wellspring of dark elixir. This dark elixir allows you to perform a variety of special actions.

classFeature.name: Dark Elixir
entries: You have 2 dark elixir, and you gain one additional dark elixir every time you level up, to a maximum of 20 at level 20. You can never have more dark elixir than shown on the table for your level. You regain all spent dark elixir when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Topping Off
entries: You can use your dark elixir to gain additional elixir, or sacrifice elixir to gain additional dark elixir. You learn other ways to use your dark elixir as you reach higher levels.

entries.name: Converting Dark Elixir into Elixir
entries: You can spend dark elixir to refill your elixir as a bonus action on your turn. Each dark elixir will net you 2 Elixir.

entries.name: Converting Elixir into Dark Elixir
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can spend 4 elixir to gain 1 dark elixir.

classFeature.name: Rigged Deck
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to adjust certain properties of your deck and the cards within on the fly to suit your needs. You gain two of the following Rigged Deck options of your choice. You gain another one at 10th and 17th level.
You can use only one Rigged Deck option on a card when you play it, unless otherwise noted.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Meta Shift
entries: At 4th level, your awareness of the evolving meta of your environment allows you to replace cards in your deck whenever you take a rest, one card for every hour rested.

classFeature.name: Blue King's Guidance
entries: At 5th level, you can tap into your inner wellspring of dark elixir to try to conjure success from failure. When you make an ability check that fails, you can spend 1 dark elixir to reroll the {@dice d20}, and you must use the new roll, potentially turning the failure into a success.

classFeature.name: Deck Archetype feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your deck archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Rigged Deck
entries: At 10th level, you learn an additional rigged deck option.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Deck Archetype feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your deck archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Rigged Deck
entries: At 17th level, you learn an additional rigged deck option.

classFeature.name: Deck Archetype feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature granted by your deck archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Dark Restoration
entries: At 20th level, you regain 4 expended dark elixir whenever you finish a short rest.

monster.name: Vengefly King

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The vengefly king doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when they fly out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If the vengefly king is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 3 ({@dice 1d6}) damage to the target.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vengefly king makes two Swipe attacks.

action.name: Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 3d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

mythicHeader: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), she takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects:

legendary.name: Summoning Scream
entries: The Vengefly King emits a screech, summoning between 0 and 2 Vengeflies in an unoccupied space within 60 ft. A maximum of 4 Vengeflies can be alive at once.
"Vicious god of territories"
Patriarch of a vengefly colony. Swoops at intruders and cries out for reinforcements if threatened.
A filthy creature that is happy to chew on any old thing it finds discarded on the cavern floor. When it notices a threat it will annoyingly scream and shriek, so kill it swiftly.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.
Flying predator that pursues its prey relentlessly.
This fierce little hunter will bravely chase down creatures many times its size. Admirable! It is weak though, and I have devoured hundreds of them with little effort or care.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The vengefly has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.
Simple-minded creature that haphazardly buzzes around, bumping into things.
They only seem dimly aware of their surroundings, making them easy prey to cut your fangs on. What is it that guides them on their paths? It almost seems like they search for ways to die.

trait.name: Pathing
entries: The gruzzer takes its full movement in a random direction and bounces off of objects and creatures it bumps into. Gruzzers can move through each other's space.

trait.name: Forceful Touch
entries: The gruzzer deals {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage to creatures it bumps into.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the gruz mother dies, it explodes in a burst of 8 Gruzzers. Each creature in a 10 ft. area must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gruz mother makes three Charge attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with Wild Slam.

action.name: Charge
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Wild Slam
entries: One creature of the dust hulk's choice inside its space must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage and has the {@condition blinded} condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.
Mature gruzzer that carries its young in its belly. Attacks by hurling its huge body around.

Bizarrely, this monster does not lay eggs but instead carries its young inside of its fat stomach. This strange practice seems to exhaust the creature, making it sleepy and vulnerable. Take advantage!
